bugs.title: CVE-2013-2208 tpp: Possibility of arbitrary code execution when processing untrusted TPP template [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2013-2208 tpp: Possibility of arbitrary code execution when processing untrusted TPP template [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2013-2208 tpp: Possibility of arbitrary code execution when processing untrusted TPP template

long_desc.thetext:
A security flaw was found in the way tpp, a ncurses-based presentation tool, processed TPP templates containing --exec clause (input provided as an argument of the --exec clause would be immediately executed without requesting a second confirmation from the user). A remote attacker could provide a specially-crafted text presentation program (TPP) template that, when processed with the tpp binary would lead to arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the user running the tpp executable.

References:
[1] http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=706644

Relevant patch from Debian distribution (adds requirement
the user to explicitly confirm code execution is desired):
[2] http://patch-tracker.debian.org/patch/series/view/tpp/1.3.1-3/15-optional-exec.patch

Created attachment 763691
Local copy of Debian patch from http://patch-tracker.debian.org/patch/series/view/tpp/1.3.1-3/15-optional-exec.patch

This issue affects the versions of the tpp package, as shipped with Fedora release of 17 and 18. Please schedule an update.

--

This issue affects the version of the tpp package, as shipped with Fedora EPEL 6. Please schedule an update.

This message is a reminder that Fedora 18 is nearing its end of life.
Approximately 4 (four) weeks from now Fedora will stop maintaining
and issuing updates for Fedora 18. It is Fedora's policy to close all
bug reports from releases that are no longer maintained. At that time
this bug will be closed as WONTFIX if it remains open with a Fedora 
'version' of '18'.

Package Maintainer: If you wish for this bug to remain open because you
plan to fix it in a currently maintained version, simply change the 'version' 
to a later Fedora version prior to Fedora 18's end of life.

Thank you for reporting this issue and we are sorry that we may not be 
able to fix it before Fedora 18 is end of life. If you would still like 
to see this bug fixed and are able to reproduce it against a later version 
of Fedora, you are encouraged  change the 'version' to a later Fedora 
version prior to Fedora 18's end of life.

Although we aim to fix as many bugs as possible during every release's 
lifetime, sometimes those efforts are overtaken by events. Often a 
more recent Fedora release includes newer upstream software that fixes 
bugs or makes them obsolete.
Patch applied to el6, f19, f20.

Fedora 18 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2014-01-14. Fedora 18 is
no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further
security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug.

If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of
Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you
are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the
current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this
bug.

Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
tpp-1.3.1-17.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tpp-1.3.1-17.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tpp-1.3.1-17.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: tpp has invalid dependency on epel6

bugzilla.short_desc: tpp has invalid dependency on epel6

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

tpp-1.3.1-9.el6.noarch
  unresolved deps: 
     vim-filesystem


vim-filesystem is not available on epel6/rhel6.
tpp is still not installable on epel6 because of the vim-filesystem requirement which is not available on rhel6. Please fix.
vim 7.3.011-3 added the vim-filesystem sub-package.
completely fell off my radar. Thanks for the update.
Bug 1037865 seems to have a fix for this problem.

Jesus, are you going commit this to dist-git? Adam Miller fixed the dependency problems and has a working SPEC here:

  http://maxamillion.fedorapeople.org/tpp.spec

I updated the package in all branches tonight.

http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=491454

New package doesn't resolve this issue and add new issue, dependency for ruby(release) which is not available on epel6.

Commit: 38a289ec4642b6b9d1d03de37c21c3db6d94536c was suppose to fix the vim-filesystem dependency issue but it didn't include any changes.

but there is no change to dependencies in the spec so actual fix was not included.

Commit: 6aefe21bc9a523da8ffebfc1d1ca0b1f9458a885 add this new broken ruby(release) dependency which shouldn't be there for epel6.

The spec mentioned in Comment 5 has fixes for both of these issues.

(In reply to Tuomo Soini from comment #7)
> New package doesn't resolve this issue and add new issue, dependency for
> ruby(release) which is not available on epel6.
> 
> Commit: 38a289ec4642b6b9d1d03de37c21c3db6d94536c was suppose to fix the
> vim-filesystem dependency issue but it didn't include any changes.
> 
> but there is no change to dependencies in the spec so actual fix was not
> included.
> 
> Commit: 6aefe21bc9a523da8ffebfc1d1ca0b1f9458a885 add this new broken
> ruby(release) dependency which shouldn't be there for epel6.
> 
> The spec mentioned in Comment 5 has fixes for both of these issues.

UGH, I completely messed up that patch! DAMN! I'll get that done today.
